remarks: Extracting the minimum positive integer for which a property ` ch ` does not hold.  This uses substitutions similar to ~ nn0ind .  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 6-May-2018.)
statement:
nn0min.0 $e |- ( n = 0 -> ( ps <-> ch ) ) $.
nn0min.1 $e |- ( n = m -> ( ps <-> th ) ) $.
nn0min.2 $e |- ( n = ( m + 1 ) -> ( ps <-> ta ) ) $.
nn0min.3 $e |- ( ph -> -. ch ) $.
nn0min.4 $e |- ( ph -> E. n e. NN ps ) $.
nn0min $p |- ( ph -> E. m e. NN0 ( -. th /\ ta ) ) $.
$d ch m n $.
$d m n ph $.
$d m ps $.
$d n ta $.
$d n th $.
